title: Accelerin Review
author: Andrew (Editor)

organizations.name: accelerin review diet reviews / fat burner reviews / accelerin review

text:
Diet Reviews / Fat Burner Reviews / Accelerin Review 
Is Accelerin a “limitless pill”? We’ve heard the buzz, so we focused closely on the ingredients, side effects, and clinical research. Furthermore, we addressed hundreds of user comments and testimonials. Then, we compiled the facts to give you the details you need. Accelerin Readers:   Leptigen. What is Accelerin? 
To start off, Accelerin is a nootropic or cognitive supplement. The ingredients include magnesium, potassium, aspartic acid, gelatin, rice flour, and cellulose. It is recommended that individuals take two or three capsules daily. However, if you weigh more than 200 pounds, they recommend doubling the dose. 
Accelerin is produced by Marco Pharma, which was created in 1991 in Germany. They create mainly homeopathic remedies for both consumers and pharmaceutical companies for mass production. Accelerin is a part of their “professional line,” which means only physicians and distributors have access keeping it in the hands of the professionals but read on… Can getting your brain on the right track help you stay on track with weight-loss? Side Effects – “What Are the Consequences?” 
The first issue tackled were Accelerin side effects. “The last thing customers need is unwanted effects resulting from product consumption,” said our Research Editor. “Issues with this one are a problem some individuals have been experiencing, which is not okay.” 
One person said, “My skin is all blotchy red and hot [and] I feel weak.” 
“Accelerin…works well, but it could be stronger,” said another. 
We could not find any reviews mentioning a lack of side effects. 
Scroll below for one of the best products we’ve seen in the past year. Scroll   Ineffective – “Why Doesn’t Accelerin Work?” 
The second issue we found with Accelerin was its ability to cause affect cognition effectively. According to some customer reviews, people seem to have no results after consuming the supplement. 
“I [took] Accelerin for a week and only noticed…no brain-boosting power,” a review said. 
However, some customers had a different experience. 
“I just started using Accelerin four days ago, and it has been working,” one person wrote. 
“Accelerin…works well, but it could be stronger,” wrote another. 
In our years of research, we’ve found it can take something that seems small to ruin the chance of measurable results. If Accelerin causes adverse issues and is ineffective, that’s not the best thing. The Science – “Where Is the Evidence?” 
Scientific research shows the health benefits of magnesium, potassium and aspartic acid. However, these components can be found in a cheaper multivitamin. There is no evidence that Accelerin is better than this alternative, which is disappointing. Before we support any supplement, we like see an ample amount of research, which does not seem to be present in this case.   Accelerin Work? 
Should you race out to buy, according to research and Accelerin reviews? Well, we do like that the recommended dose is based on weight, which might make it more efficient. Additionally, the supplement is available only to physicians and distributors, which means possible results are taken into consideration before the patient starts it. However, there seem to be some real problems concerning the issues they cause and the effectiveness. 
If you want to lose weight, we suggest using a product that works efficiently and is focused on that and not cognition.
